text: Is there a easy way to show a list of already downloaded artifacts/shards on a local machine? The closest thing I could find in the docs is `BinaryBuilderBase.macos_sdk_already_installed`

elements.text: Is there a easy way to show a list of already downloaded artifacts/shards on a local machine? The closest thing I could find in the docs is

text: I don't think there is anything ready.  you need to go through the `Artifacts.toml` of BBB and collect the git-tree-sha1 of the shards

of BBB and collect the git-tree-sha1 of the shards

text: Would something like that be possibly be useful to other people? Worth opening an issue?

text: Maybe? Honestly, I never had the need to check this: when I need a shard it's automatically downloaded

text:
That's kind of what I was thinking, BB seems to know if it needs a shard somehow?

For context, I got myself down this path about when I was running into artifact downloads hanging on me when running a `build_tarballs.jl` but I got around it by using `BinaryBuilderBase.download_all_artifacts` manually and then ctrl+C after I got the one I needed.

text: if the issue is only with downloading, the solution is likely to just disable package server: set the environment variable `JULIA_PKG_SERVER=""`

elements.text: if the issue is only with downloading, the solution is likely to just disable package server: set the environment variable

text: The downloading is fine now. Now I was wondering how much stuff I had downloaded to my machine and if I could clean it up to free space XD
